Note: The yaml files used in this tutorial are stored in docs/examples/mysql folder in GitHub repository kubedb/docs. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: Use Stash to Backup MySQL
item.description: Use Stash to Backup MySQL Stash by AppsCode is a Kubernetes operator for backup and recovery of Kubernetes stateful workloads. Stash v0.9.0+ supports backup and restoration of MySQL databases. KubeDB v0.13.0+ comes with built-in support for Stash. We recommend to use Stash for backup and restore your MySQL databases instead of KubeDB’s native method. This guide will give you an overview of why you should use Stash to backup and restore your MySQL databases.
